page.title: 02Bailrigg Village
page.content: the University of Lancaster is built on a plateau which is half a mile long. The buildings are arranged from a long central spine and it is possible to walk from one end to the other under cover. This site was chosen because of its natural shape, good drainage and also because the height of the area makes the buildings look more impressive. Bailrigg village was built in a valley to give shelter and because it is near a spring line. Until ten years ago the residents drank pure spring water but now they have a purifier in the system. The M6 motorway follows the lowest contour with little artificial banking. The main part of our block is grass covered hills fising to around q80 metres which are used for grazing
